sum

public static double sum(java.lang.Number[] array,
                         int decimalPlaces)
Sums up an array of numbers. The result is rounded to the count of decimal digits specified. This is done in order to eliminate errors caused by floating point arithmetic.

Parameters:
array - Array of number to sum
decimalPlaces - count of decimal places
Returns:
Returns the sum of the array.

formatInt

public static java.lang.String formatInt(java.lang.Number n,
                                         int integerDigits)
Creates a formatted string from a number with a specified number of minimum integer digits. The number is converted to a long. Precision may be lost, if the input has decimal digits.

Parameters:
n - number to format.
integerDigits -
Returns:
Returns a formatted string for the parameter

formatInteger

public static java.lang.String formatInteger(java.lang.Integer n,
                                             java.lang.Integer chars)
Formats an integer adding zeroes as most significant digits if necessary in order to return a string of a given length that is equal to the integer when parsed. If the given integer's string representation requires more chars than the given digits number it is returned without changing it.

Parameters:
n - the integer
chars - the number of chars for the wanted string representation
Returns:
the integer as String

isFractionalType

public static boolean isFractionalType(java.lang.Number number)
